TopicTitle: What are some tips and tricks?

Articles.Content: I haven't really played since 0.22 and would like some tips and tricks for the newer versions!
Exactly what kind of tips are you looking for? Construction, ascension, space travel, landing, maneuvering, or rendezvousing?
Futher more, 1.0 will change many things. Best to wait few days.

> Futher more, 1.0 will change many things. Best to wait few days.

AFAIK there's been no word on a 1.0 release date, so if the OP feels like KSP *now*, then I'd say it's a fair call to start. For all we know, 1.0 won't hit until June/July ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) That said, it may make sense just to have a simple career game, rather than mod it to the max and go for a 6 month campaign.

A few suggestions for newcomers to 0.90:

- You can only take two missions at once; be careful which you choose initially. 

- Don't blow past all the height record missions at once. Take some fuel out of your early ships so you can get the rewards for 10, 25, and 50km in sequence. If your first shot breaks the atmosphere, you've lost your chance at the later runs.

- Prioritise upgrading your mission control, and tracking station to tier 2. This will give you the ability to take more missions at once (more profit!) and make manoeuvre nodes. Munlandings are practical with tier 1, but anything beyond is risky.

- Beware of the MK3 parts. The joints are weak, and the wings/wheels/engines currently available aren't big enough for them. 

- SAS doesn't work without a pilot kerbal, or a probe that specifically says it has SAS (the Stayputnik does not!), so your early missions will probably have to be manned and flown by Jeb, or some other pilot you hire. Bill and Bob tend not to get a look in until you have multi-man capsules.

- Remember you can't EVA or take surface samples until you upgrade your astronaut complex. See tooltips in KSC for details of how to unlock these features.
